headline: How Recent Moves Are Rewriting the Growth Story for Wolters Kluwer
summary: Wolters Kluwer's latest valuation update reflects a slightly lower fair value estimate of €138.00, driven by marginally more conservative assumptions around its long term outlook. The move comes amid successive target reductions from major brokers like JPMorgan, which see the shares as fairly valued with more limited upside, even as the company’s resilient recurring revenue and strong competitive position continue to anchor sentiment. Stay tuned to see how investors can track these subtle...

headline: JPMorgan Warns: AI Hype Has Peaked — 2026 Is About Profits
summary: Generative AI dominated narratives in 2025, but the financial payoff hasn't kept pace with the hype. JPMorgan's 2026 outlook, backed by new CEO survey data, suggests markets are now recalibrating expectations — shifting focus from AI adoption to whether it actually delivers profits. GenAI Fell Short Of CEO Expectations PwC's latest global CEO survey, covering more than 4,700 executives across 109 countries, shows a clear expectation gap. While over 40% of CEOs entered 2025 expecting GenAI to boo

headline: Trump Might Limit Defense-Stock Dividends. That’s a Bad Idea.
summary: President Donald Trump is playing Santa Claus.  The president is considering an executive order that would limit defense companies’ ability to pay dividends or buy back stock if projects are behind schedule or over budget, according to a report from Reuters.  The White House didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.

content.title: Trump Might Limit Defense-Stock Dividends. That’s a Bad Idea.
content.summary: President Donald Trump is playing Santa Claus.  The president is considering an executive order that would limit defense companies’ ability to pay dividends or buy back stock if projects are behind schedule or over budget, according to a report from Reuters.  The White House didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.

headline: How Recent Developments Are Reshaping The Postal Realty Trust Investment Story
summary: Postal Realty Trust has seen its fair value estimate inch higher from $16.66 to $17.93 per share as analysts factor in faster rental income growth and better cash flow visibility across its portfolio. A modest drop in the discount rate from 7.94% to about 7.50% has also boosted the present value of expected cash flows, even as some forecasts still build in cautious assumptions on long term growth and risk. Read on to see how you can track these evolving targets and stay ahead of the shifting...

content.title: How Recent Developments Are Reshaping The Postal Realty Trust Investment Story
content.summary: Postal Realty Trust has seen its fair value estimate inch higher from $16.66 to $17.93 per share as analysts factor in faster rental income growth and better cash flow visibility across its portfolio. A modest drop in the discount rate from 7.94% to about 7.50% has also boosted the present value of expected cash flows, even as some forecasts still build in cautious assumptions on long term growth and risk. Read on to see how you can track these evolving targets and stay ahead of the shifting...

headline: Service Compression Announces $400 Million ABL Facility Upsize
summary: Service Compression, LLC ("Service Compression" or "SC"), a leading provider of natural gas compression services to exploration and production companies, today announced the successful upsize of its asset‑based loan (ABL) credit facility to $400 million, representing a $100 million increase from the prior facility. The upsized facility closed on December 17, 2025, and is led by J.P. Morgan.

content.title: Service Compression Announces $400 Million ABL Facility Upsize
content.summary: Service Compression, LLC ("Service Compression" or "SC"), a leading provider of natural gas compression services to exploration and production companies, today announced the successful upsize of its asset‑based loan (ABL) credit facility to $400 million, representing a $100 million increase from the prior facility. The upsized facility closed on December 17, 2025, and is led by J.P. Morgan.

headline: JPMorgan Quants Warn of ‘Extreme Crowding’ in Speculative Stocks
summary: The list includes Broadcom Inc., Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Expedia Group Inc., Estee Lauder Cos Inc., Invesco Ltd. and Nucor Corp.  The selloff has been led by tech shares as investors rotate out of winners — an event the JPMorgan quants warned about.

content.title: JPMorgan Quants Warn of ‘Extreme Crowding’ in Speculative Stocks
content.summary: The list includes Broadcom Inc., Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Expedia Group Inc., Estee Lauder Cos Inc., Invesco Ltd. and Nucor Corp.  The selloff has been led by tech shares as investors rotate out of winners — an event the JPMorgan quants warned about.

headline: Why Analysts See the D-Market Story Shifting After Reset Price Target and Strategy Changes
summary: D Market Elektronik Hizmetler ve Ticaret has seen its near term price target reset to $3.07, even as fair value remains anchored at $3.47 per share. Analysts frame this shift as a recalibration toward execution risk, with growth initiatives around customer and merchant acquisition expected to pay off later rather than sooner. Read on to see how you can track these evolving expectations and stay updated on the changing narrative around the stock. Analyst Price Targets don't always capture the...
